intro: Psychotria crassifolia, commonly known as the thick-leafed psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded forest environments. The plant is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often consumed by birds and other wildlife. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
